alert.note: Alert for Central Ventura County Valleys; Lake Casitas; Ojai Valley; Santa Barbara County Interior Mountains; Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Ynez Mountains Eastern Range; Ventura County Beaches; Ventura County Inland Coast; Ventura County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 12 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...A line of strong showers and possibly thunderstorms will affect portions of west central Ventura and southeast Santa Barbara Counties through 200 AM PST... At 1252 AM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a line of very intense showers in the Santa Barbara Channel. Two cells were particularly strong and were showing some rotation. The northern cell will affect southeastern Santa Barbara County from Goleta to Carpinteria, including Santa Barbara and Santa Barbara Harbor. The southern cell will affect coastal Ventura County from La Conchita to Ventura including Ventura Harbor. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ventura...Santa Barbara...Montecito...Carpinteria...Summerland... Ventura Harbor...La Conchita...Rincon Point...Goleta... Solimar Beach and Seacliff. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
